messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] RV'ing
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/1/2003 11:45:01 AM Pacific Standard Time, ... There are seatbelts in just about all the seats provided except for the dinette. So if you
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/1/2003 11:45:01 AM Pacific Standard Time,
jmcseals@... writes:

> Has anyone ever rented an RV? We are looking into it as an option for our
> SC trip. I have so many questions, but most important: what do you do
> with
> the kids? Are there seatbelts? Can/should they sleep in the beds while
> driving? What about when they are awake?
>
>
There are seatbelts in just about all the seats provided except for the
dinette.
So if you have a sofa and chair, there will be seatbelts there. Our
motorhome
is a bit older so I don't know if newer ones have seatbelts in the dinette. I
wish ours did. I allow the kids to sleep in the back bedroom. I believe all
seatbelt laws apply whether you are in a RV or auto, so they should be
belted in.

Kathy


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
